item.title: Oppo Reno 13 5G Series India Launch Teased; Design, Colour Options, Availability Revealed - Gadgets 360
item.description:
Oppo Reno 13 5G Series India Launch, Design, Colour Options Confirmed

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: Gadgets 360

The Oppo Reno 13 5G series, previously launched in China, is set to launch in India soon. The handsets have confirmed designs and colour options, with the upcoming models anticipated to succeed the Reno 12 series.

  • Oppo Reno 13 series includes base and Pro variants.
  • Expected release on Flipkart and Oppo India e-store.
  • Available in two RAM and storage configurations.
  • Base model features Ivory White and Luminous Blue shades.
  • Pro model available in Graphite Grey and Mist Lavender.
  • Both models equipped with 50-megapixel cameras and large batteries.
“Both phones will have an aerospace-grade aluminium frame.”

More details about the launch date and additional specifications will be revealed soon.

item.title: MediaTek Dimensity 8400 Chipset With Improved Multi-Core Performance and AI Capabilities Launched - Gadgets 360
item.description:
MediaTek Debuts Dimensity 8400 Chipset for Mobile With AI Capabilities

Date: Monday
Source: Gadgets 360

MediaTek has launched the Dimensity 8400 chipset aimed at premium smartphones, boasting significant performance improvements and AI capabilities.

  • All-big-core design targeting premium smartphone market.
  • 41% improvement in multi-core performance over Dimensity 8300.
  • Features an NPU for generative AI tasks.
  • Xiaomi's upcoming Redmi Turbo 4 will utilize this chipset.
  • Supports up to LPDDR5x RAM and UFS 4.0 storage.
  • Equipped with MediaTek Imagiq 1080 ISP for enhanced camera capabilities.
  • 5G-A modem performance up to 5.17 Gbps with support for Wi-Fi 6E.
"The Dimensity 8400 can deliver 21% faster outputs in Stable Diffusion and 33% faster text generation in AI models than its predecessor." - MediaTek

The Dimensity 8400 is set to reshape mobile processing, with powerful AI capabilities and improved efficiency, marking a significant step forward for MediaTek in the competitive smartphone chipset market.

item.title: Is Radeon RX 9070 XT the new RDNA 4 GPU? New naming scheme and other possibilities explored - Sportskeeda
item.description:
Is Radeon RX 9070 XT the new RDNA 4 GPU? New naming scheme and other possibilities explored

Publication Date: Not mentioned

Source: Sportskeeda

AMD may be skipping the Radeon RX 8000 branding for a new RDNA 4 GPU series, adopting an Nvidia-style naming convention. This article explores the implications of this leak, potential impacts on competition, and AMD's strategy moving forward.

  • AMD's new RDNA 4 GPU naming convention may skip RX 8000 in favor of RX 9000.
  • The new naming scheme starts with 9, followed by a zero, similar to Nvidia's branding.
  • Potential upcoming AMD APUs may reserve the 8000 series for integrated graphics.
  • This change is seen as a strategic move to enhance competitiveness against Nvidia GPUs.
  • Price competitiveness is crucial for AMD's success with the new series.
“If the company seriously wants to compete with Nvidia this time, the pricing of the RDNA 4 GPUs must be highly competitive.”

The shift to a new naming scheme represents a significant branding strategy for AMD, aiming to better position itself against Nvidia in the graphics card market.

item.title: WhatsApp may stop working on these Android smartphones starting next week - The Times of India
item.description:
WhatsApp May Stop Working on Certain Android Smartphones Next Week

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

WhatsApp is set to discontinue support for some older Android smartphones starting next week, affecting users with devices that do not meet the new requirements.

  • Digging into compatibility issues, WhatsApp has outlined specific Android versions on which its app will cease to function.
  • The changes are part of WhatsApp's continuous effort to ensure better security and performance.
  • Users impacted will need to upgrade their devices or operating systems to continue using the app.
"This move aims to enhance user experience by requiring newer operating systems that offer more features and security."

Users are advised to check their device compatibility before the cutoff date to avoid inconveniences.

item.title: MediaTek unveils Dimensity 8400, the first mid-range chipset with all big core design - The Indian Express
item.description:
MediaTek unveils Dimensity 8400, the first mid-range chipset with all big core design

Publication Date: December 2024 Source: Indian Express

The new Dimensity 8400 chipset by MediaTek is set to make waves in the mid-range smartphone market. It features an all big core design, boasting 41% more multi-core performance while reducing energy consumption by 44% compared to its predecessor.

  • Powered by eight ARM Cortex-A725 cores at 3.25GHz.
  • Mali-G720 GPU offers a 24% performance boost while using 42% less power.
  • It includes innovations like Frame Rate Converter and Adaptive Gaming Technology 3.0 for enhanced gameplay.
  • The NPU 880 enables advanced processing for large language models and context-aware replies.
  • Dimensions support for camera sensors up to 320MP and features Imagiq 1080 14-bit HDR ISP.
  • First devices to feature this chipset, like Xiaomi's Redmi Turbo 4, will launch by year-end.
“The Dimensity 8400 chipset is designed to disrupt the mid-range smartphone segment.”

This release marks a significant step forward in mobile processing technology, emphasizing performance and efficiency for consumers.

item.title: Meta to add display to Ray-Bans as race over smart glasses intensifies - Financial Times
item.description:
Meta Plans Display Features for Ray-Ban Smart Glasses Amidst Competition

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Financial Times

Meta is set to enhance its Ray-Ban smart glasses with display capabilities expected to roll out by 2025, as they vie with competitors for the future of wearable technology.

  • Meta aims to integrate a display in partnership with EssilorLuxottica, expected to show notifications.
  • The new version could potentially reposition the device as a primary computing tool for consumers.
  • Despite ongoing losses in its Reality Labs division, Meta continues to innovate in the AR/VR space.
  • The Ray-Ban glasses have gained popularity since a recent product update, which features audio and camera capabilities.
  • Challenges remain in developing fashionable, affordable AR glasses that do not compromise on performance and battery life.
“Meta proved that these lightweight glasses, even without a display, could be interesting and useful.” – Michael Miller, Niantic

Meta's advancements in AR technology reflect a significant shift towards integrating AI with mixed reality, crucial for future developments in wearable tech.

item.title: Realme 14x 5G vs Poco M7 Pro 5G: Your budget smartphone under 15000? - PCQuest
item.description:
Realme 14x 5G vs Poco M7 Pro 5G: Your budget smartphone under 15000?

Publication Date: Not specified, Source: Not specified

If you’re in the market for an affordable 5G smartphone, Realme and Poco have introduced two compelling options this week—the Realme 14x 5G and the Poco M7 Pro 5G. Both devices fall within the Rs 15,000 price range, offering an attractive mix of features, specifications, and design elements that cater to budget-conscious buyers.

  • Durable design and military-grade certification for Realme 14x 5G.
  • Poco M7 Pro 5G features an AMOLED display with superior brightness.
  • Realme 14x 5G offers a longer battery life with a 6000mAh battery.
  • Poco M7 Pro 5G has better camera specifications including a 20MP selfie camera.
  • Both are priced competitively at Rs 14,999 for their base variants.
"Go for Realme 14x 5G if you value durability, long battery life, and a rugged design suitable for outdoor use."

Conclusion: The choice between Realme 14x 5G and Poco M7 Pro 5G ultimately depends on user priorities, whether it be durability and battery life or display quality and camera performance.

item.title: Should chess players invest in their diet? - Sportstar
item.description:
Should Chess Players Invest in Their Diet?

Date: October 2023 | Source: The Hindu

Chess performance is closely tied to diet. The article explores how proper nutrition impacts focus, stamina, and mental clarity in chess players, debunking myths about calorie burning and emphasizing the importance of smart dietary choices for optimal performance.

  • High mental exertion can increase daily energy expenditure by 200-300 calories, not 6,000.
  • A proper diet can enhance memory and decision-making skills, crucial for chess.
  • Foods rich in Omega-3 fatty acids are vital for brain function.
  • Intermittent fasting and nootropic foods are emerging trends among cognitive athletes.
  • Genetic understanding may help players customize their diets for peak performance.
“The right diet could be your ultimate secret weapon.”

In conclusion, chess players can significantly benefit from focusing on their nutrition, as it directly influences their mental acuity and game performance.

item.title: Apple AirPods Pro 3 May Feature Heart-Rate Monitor, Temperature Sensor - Deccan Chronicle
item.description:
Apple AirPods Pro 3 May Feature Heart-Rate Monitor and Temperature Sensor

Publication Date: N/A Source: Mark Gurman's Power On newsletter

Apple is reportedly working on a variety of health features for AirPods, which is expected to roll out in the coming years.

  • Health features like a heart-rate monitor and temperature sensor are being developed for AirPods Pro 3.
  • The heart-rate monitor is the primary focus in internal testing, showing promise based on Apple Watch data.
  • Additional features may include tracking of physiological measures.
  • Apple is also reviving camera development for AirPods, which had previously been cancelled.
  • The development timeline for these features is expected to be a couple of years.
  • Recently, AirPods Pro 2 received a firmware update allowing them to be used as FDA-certified hearing aids.
“Apple is moving towards a health-oriented direction.”

This development indicates Apple's commitment to integrating health technology into its ecosystem, enhancing the functionality of its audio devices.

item.title: In 5 pictures: Real-life Iron Man suit could help paraplegic walk - India Today
item.description:
In 5 pictures: Real-life Iron Man suit could help paraplegic walk

Publication Date: December 2024 | Source: India Today

Researchers from South Korea's KAIST developed the WalkON Suit F1, a robotic exoskeleton that allows paraplegic users to walk, climb stairs, and navigate obstacles.

  • The WalkON Suit F1 weighs 50 kg and integrates 12 electronic motors.
  • It assists wheelchair users to stand and move.
  • Equipped with sensors and cameras, it analyzes surroundings for balance and navigation.
  • Paraplegic team member Kim Seung-hwan demonstrated its capabilities, winning in the Cybathlon 2024.
  • The project is inspired by Iron Man to enhance independence for individuals with disabilities.
“We aim to merge robotics with human lives to enhance independence for individuals with disabilities.” - Park Jeong-su

This innovative technology holds the potential to significantly improve mobility and quality of life for paraplegics.

item.title: Oppo Reno 13 And Reno 13 Pro India Launch In January 2025: All You Need To Know - Times Now
item.description:
Oppo Reno 13 and Reno 13 Pro Set to Launch in India in January 2025

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Times Now

The Oppo Reno 13 series is confirmed to launch in India by the end of January 2025, featuring significant upgrades in design and camera setup.

  • The Reno 13 Pro will be available in Graphite Grey and Mist Lavender.
  • The Reno 13 will come in Ivory White and Luminous Blue.
  • Both models will feature a triple camera setup and an OLED display.
  • The Reno 13 Pro has a thickness of 7.55mm and weighs 195g, while the Reno 13 ranges between 7.24 to 7.29mm and weighs 181g.
  • Both phones are expected to be 5G capable and include premium features like IP66, IP68, and IP69 ratings.
  • The Reno 13 Pro will likely come with a MediaTek Dimensity 8350 chipset, according to leaks.
“The Reno 13 series will sport a triple camera setup and a flat display.”

In conclusion, the Oppo Reno 13 series promises to bring advanced features and elegant designs to the smartphone market in early 2025.

item.title: Heart rate monitoring and more: Apple testing health-tracking tech for AirPods Pro 3, Gurman reveals | Mint - Mint
item.description:
Heart rate monitoring and more: Apple testing health-tracking tech for AirPods Pro 3, Gurman reveals

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Livemint

Apple is reportedly developing its next-generation AirPods Pro, which may include advanced health-tracking features, building upon the capabilities of the previous model.

  • AirPods Pro 3 expected to have features like heart-rate monitor and temperature sensor.
  • The heart-rate data will sync with the Apple Health app, requiring the use of both earbuds.
  • Projected launch timeline suggests a possible release in 2027 with additional health tools and AI functionalities.
  • Apple is also focusing on smart home technology with an anticipated AI-driven smart home hub in 2025.
"Apple appears poised to strengthen its ecosystem by merging health technology with its audio offerings, continuing its trajectory of innovation in wearable tech."

This development could significantly enhance the AirPods line-up, emphasizing Apple's commitment to integrating health features into its products.

item.title: Nothing Phone 3 Release Date, Price In India, Design, Specifications, Leaks, Everything You Need To Know - Times Now
item.description:
Nothing Phone 3 Release Date, Price In India, Design, Specifications, Leaks

Publication Date: N/A Source: Times Now

The Nothing Phone 3, expected to launch in 2025, aims to feature advanced AI capabilities, a transparent design, and powerful hardware.

  • Expected launch delayed to 2025 for advanced AI features integration.
  • Signature design with transparent back and LED light strips.
  • 6.67-inch LTPO AMOLED display with 120Hz refresh rate.
  • Powered by Snapdragon 8 Gen 3 or Elite chipset, up to 12GB RAM.
  • Customisable action buttons inspired by iPhone.
  • Pro variant expected with higher-end specs.
  • Pricing: Pro above Rs 55,000, regular under Rs 50,000.
“customizable action buttons, which look to take inspiration from iPhone.”

The Nothing Phone 3 is poised to be a significant player in the mid-range smartphone market, leveraging its innovative design and features.

item.title: Galaxy Unpacked 2025: Samsung may introduce 'Slim' model in S25 series - Business Standard
item.description:
Galaxy Unpacked 2025: Samsung may introduce 'Slim' model in S25 series

Publication Date: January 2025 Source: 91mobiles

Samsung is set to unveil the Galaxy S25 series in January 2025, with potential plans for a new 'Slim' model coming later in the second quarter.

  • The Galaxy S25 Slim is expected to be only 6mm thick, compared to 7.6mm for the Galaxy S24.
  • The smartphone may offer a 6.66-inch display and a 4,700mAh battery.
  • It is likely to include a triple-camera system: a 200MP main sensor, a 50MP telephoto lens, and a 50MP ultra-wide lens.
  • The device may feature a Qualcomm Snapdragon 8 Elite processor.
  • It aims to compete directly with Apple's iPhone 17 Air.
“Samsung’s Galaxy S25 Slim could be a direct competitor to Apple’s thin-profile iPhone 17 Air.”

In summary, the Galaxy S25 Slim emphasizes a sleek design and competitive specifications, setting the stage for an interesting market battle with Apple's upcoming offerings.

item.title: WhatsApp to stop working on older phones, including some samsung Galaxy models, after December 31 - India TV News
item.description:
WhatsApp to Stop Working on Older Phones After December 31

Publication Date: December 23, 2024 | Source: India TV News

WhatsApp, with over two billion users, will discontinue support for several older smartphone models from January 1, 2025, impacting users primarily on older versions of Android.

  • More than 20 smartphones will lose access, primarily those running Android KitKat and earlier.
  • Brands affected include Samsung, LG, Motorola, HTC, and Sony.
  • Users will not receive updates, bug fixes, or security patches on these devices.
  • The change also affects other Meta platforms such as Facebook and Instagram.
“Older operating systems lack the necessary capabilities for advanced features and can present security vulnerabilities.”

Though WhatsApp will continue to function on these phones, the lack of support for updates raises security concerns for users with outdated devices.
